=== Open Source in my life ===
I've been using computers since i was 8 years old (1990). In 1994 i had my first contact with Linux (<nowiki>[[http://www.slackware.org/|Slackware]]</nowiki>), and since then i have dual-booted. In Aug 2000 i went for an exchange at the <nowiki>[[http://www.ualberta.ca|University of Alberta]]</nowiki>, where i had my first contact with BSD Syestems. That was, because every computer on the lab used <nowiki>[[http://www.openbsd.org/|OpenBSD]]</nowiki>. That forced me to leave proprietary software behind. On 2001 I came back to Brasil, and since then I have single-booted on either BSD (mostly <nowiki>[[http://www.freebsd.org/|FreeBSD]]</nowiki>) or Linux.

I'm just about to graduate as a Informatics B.Sc. in the Pontific Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro (<nowiki>[[http://www.puc-rio.br/|PUC-Rio]]</nowiki>). And for the last years I have done free-lancer jobs -mostly- in free software.

== Contributions ==

=== Outside Ubuntu ===

* Organize the yearly GUL PUC-Rio's Free Software Week.
* Develop pyTransRio - a PyGTK application to view traffic cameras in Rio de Janeiro
* Develop <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/projects/phplanet/|PHPlanet]]</nowiki> - A blog agregator tool 100% developed by Ubuntu Brasil Comunity. Inspired by the <nowiki>[[http://planetplanet.org|Planet]]</nowiki> software.

=== Ubuntu Brasil LoCoTeam ===

* Organization of the regionalization plans for Ubuntu-BR
* Help stablish and deploy the Ubuntu Brasil Community's <nowiki>[[http://planeta.ubuntubrasil.org|Planet]]</nowiki>
* Migrated the <nowiki>[[http://planeta.ubuntubrasil.org|Planet]]</nowiki> to the new PHPlanet engine
* Post How-To's and news to the <nowiki>[[http://planeta.ubuntubrasil.org|Planet]]</nowiki>
* Help organize Ubuntu-BR's wiki pages
* Help fellow Ubunteros on #ubuntu-br @ FreeNode and Ubuntu Brasil's maillist

=== Things that I want to do ===

* Mantain <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/projects/phplanet/|PHPlanet]]</nowiki> project.
* Help the Ubuntu Community in any way that i can
